generic.question: Which of the following are true?
generic.footerText: To learn more about ${mediaAreaText} permits, visit ${mediaAreaLink}.
generic.ariaContextEnvStepperLabels: Environment Permit Stepper Navigation: ${stepName} Step, State: ${stepState}
generic.errorText: Provide responses to the following sections:
generic.title: Tell Us About Your Business

instructions.lineOne: Do you need Department of Environmental Protection (DEP) permits for your business?
instructions.lineTwoPtOne: Your responses are secure and will
instructions.lineThree: You may be fined if you operate without the necessary permits.

questionnaireOptions.hazardousMedicalWaste: My business will generate `hazardous waste|hazardous-waste` or `medical waste|medical-waste`.
questionnaireOptions.compostWaste: My business will `compost waste|compost-waste` on site.
questionnaireOptions.treatProcessWaste: My business will treat or process waste.
questionnaireOptions.constructionDebris: My business will process `construction/demolition debris|construction-and-demo-debris` and recyclable materials.

land.mediaAreaLink: [NJDEP’s page on the Watershed and Land Management Program](https://dep.nj.gov/wlm/)

questionnaireOptions.takeOverExistingBiz: My business will take over an existing business or a site where a business used to be.
questionnaireOptions.propertyAssessment: My business will carry out `property assessment|property-assessment` work at the site.
questionnaireOptions.constructionActivities: My business will carry out construction activities on a site affecting 0.25 or more acres of land.
questionnaireOptions.siteImprovementWasteLands: My business will carry out site improvement in or near wetlands or flood hazard areas. This includes activities such as cutting down trees.

questionnaireOptions.emitPollutants: My business will be using equipment that emits air `pollutants|pollutants`.
questionnaireOptions.emitEmissions: My business will release `air emissions|air-emissions` (dust, fumes, vapors, odors, etc).
questionnaireOptions.constructionActivities: My business plans to conduct construction activities (crushers, conveyors, shredders, stationary engines, or equipment that generate dust).

questionnaireOptions.ownWell: My business will have its own well for water supply with at least 15 `service connections|service-connections` , or will regularly serve an average of at least 25 people daily for at least 60 days per year.
questionnaireOptions.combinedWellCapacity: My business will have a combined well pump capacity of greater than 69 gallons per minute.
questionnaireOptions.wellDrilled: My business will need to get a well drilled on the property.
questionnaireOptions.potableWater: My business will get a potable water supply from a water utility.

questionnaireOptions.localSewage: My business will release wastewater to a local `sewage treatment plant|sewage-treatment-plant`.
questionnaireOptions.streamsRiversOrLakes: My business will release wastewater directly to streams, rivers, or lakes.
questionnaireOptions.planningConstruction: My business is planning construction for over 1 acre of land.
questionnaireOptions.stormWaterDischarge: My business will have `stormwater discharge|stormwater-discharge` related to industrial activity. This includes activities such as warehousing, trucking, and recycling.
questionnaireOptions.needsTreatment: My business will create wastewater that needs to be treated before releasing into streams, rivers, lakes, sewage treatment plants, or septic systems.
questionnaireOptions.takeoverIndustrialStormWaterPermit: My business is going to take over an existing business with an industrial stormwater permit.
questionnaireOptions.septicSystem: My business will release wastewater to a `septic system|septic-system`.

summary.partOne: Based on your answers, your business may be legally required to have Department of Environmental Protection (DEP)
summary.partTwo: licenses or permits. Find out your business's requirements below.
summary.partThree: If your business activities or equipment change,

personalizedSupport.body: An expert at SBAP can help you figure out which licenses or permits your business needs. SBAP does not regulate or enforce environmental rules.
personalizedSupport.directContactInfo: If you’d like to reach the SBAP directly, call them at 877-753-1151.
personalizedSupport.submissionCadence: You can only submit this request once.
personalizedSupport.generalErrorAlertText: Something went wrong. Please try again later.
personalizedSupport.generalErrorText: There was an error submitting your request. Please try again later.
personalizedSupport.title: Contact DEP’s Small Business Assistance Program (SBAP)

contactDep.title: Contact DEP
contactDep.body: To find out which licenses or permits you need, contact the ${bodyLink}:

contact.phoneInfo: General Water Quality and Water Supply:

lowApplicability.summaryLineOne: You most likely will not need to apply for licenses or permits with the Department of Environmental Protection (DEP).
lowApplicability.summaryLineTwo: Visit [DEP’s Permits, Applications & Registrations page](https://dep.nj.gov/permits-applications-registrations/) for more information about your license and permit needs.
lowApplicability.callout: If your business activities or equipment change at any point,
